item.description:
The snow conditions are very good, so if you have them, grab your snowshoes and meet us at Beaver Brook in Hollis, NH.

Beaver Brook is a 2000 acre property with about 35 miles of varying trails, just right for people new to snowshoeing. Snowshoeing is different than hiking and it's a lot of fun. At this time of year, with the foliage mostly gone, and no bugs to contend with, being outside is truly pleasant. People just need to dress for the conditions. Wearing layers, wearing clothes that wick water away from the body, having gloves, a hat, warm socks, and good footwear make being outdoors comfortable. And don't forget to bring fluids and something to snack on.

See beaverbrook.org for more info.

Download and print maps here: maps and trail info

The weather should be nice on Sunday. Plan on a 2-hour hike (or more if people are up for it).

Any questions, send mail to Jeff.
item.how_to_find_us: Look for me and Tessie (the friendly black lab).
item.why: The snow is beautiful, but may not last long!
item.name: Short Notice: Sunday Snowshoe
